SEARCH
Package fr.univnantes.document

Class LineNode

java.lang.Object
fr.univnantes.document.LineNode
public class LineNode extends Object
Represents a line node

A line node is a node of a document It contains a reference to the next and previous line node It also contains a reference to the first column node of the line It is used to represent a line in a document

    • insert

      public boolean insert(int index, char character)
      Inserts a new character at the given index in the line, the index starts at 0
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the character to insert, the index starts at 0 If the index is greater than the number of column nodes, new column nodes will be created to fill the gap
      character - the character to insert
      Returns:
      true if the character has been inserted, false otherwise

    • modify

      public boolean modify(int index, char character)
      Modifies the character at the given index in the line, the index starts at 0
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the character to modify, the index starts at 0
      character - the new character
      Returns:
      true if the character has been modified, false otherwise

    • delete

      public boolean delete(int index)
      Deletes the character at the given index in the line, the index starts at 0

    • deleteLineBreak

      public boolean deleteLineBreak()
      Deletes the line break at the end of the line
      Returns:
      true if the line break has been deleted, false otherwise

    • insertLineBreak

      public boolean insertLineBreak(int column)
      Inserts a line break at the given index in the line, the index starts at 0 Will split the line in two, the first part will contain the characters before the line break The second part will contain the characters after the line break
      Parameters:
      column - the index of the line break, the index starts at 0
      Returns:
      true if the line break has been inserted, false otherwise
